title: Progressive Mixed Hearing Loss
chief_complaint: I am noticing increased difficulty understanding speech in most communication settings, even though I wear hearing aids in both ears.

problem_summary.course: Progressive; last test was 3 years ago and hearing has worsened.
problem_summary.laterality: Bilateral; Right ear is poorer than the Left.
problem_summary.functional_impact: Reduced communication ability despite bilateral amplification.
problem_summary.goals_motivation: Monitoring hearing status and addressing increased difficulty.

history.present_illness: Patient presents for follow-up to monitor a known gradually progressive mixed hearing loss. The last evaluation was 3 years prior. She reports the right ear has progressed and is worse than the left.
history.medical_psych_history: No familial history of hearing loss reported.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Right ear: Moderately severe mixed loss (250-3000 Hz), severe at 2000 Hz, sloping to severe (4000-8000 Hz). Left ear: Mild sloping to moderately severe mixed loss (250-3000 Hz), sloping to severe/profound (4000-8000 Hz). Significant air-bone gaps present bilaterally. Masking dilemma noted at 250 Hz BC.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.key_findings: SRT scores are in agreement with PTA. Word recognition scores (WRS) indicate only slight difficulty in the ability to recognize speech at suprathreshold levels.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.key_findings: Right ear tympanogram is considered normal (Type A). Left ear tympanogram is hypercompliant (Type Ad).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.key_findings: Right ear reflexes could not be measured due to inability to maintain a proper seal. Left ear ipsilateral reflexes were normal; contralateral reflexes were absent (or CNT per table). Reflex decay not measured.

overall_audiologic_summary: The patient exhibits a progressive, bilateral mixed hearing loss. The right ear has deteriorated since the last evaluation 3 years ago and presents with a moderately severe to severe configuration, while the left ear shows a mild to profound configuration. Despite the degree of loss, word recognition ability remains good bilaterally at elevated levels. Immittance testing reveals hypercompliance in the left ear and technical difficulties obtaining a seal in the right ear.
counseling_points: Your hearing has changed since your last visit 3 years ago; the right ear now shows more hearing loss than the left.
There is a 'mixed' nature to your hearing loss (involving both the nerve and the middle ear system), which warrants a medical evaluation.
I am recommending a consultation with an otologist (ear specialist) to investigate the cause of the progression and the mixed component.
We should continue with your current hearing aids, but they will need adjustment to match your new hearing levels.
We will also discuss Hearing Assistive Technology (HAT) to help with the specific speech understanding difficulties you are facing.
notes_for_actor: Portray a patient who is accustomed to wearing hearing aids but is frustrated that they aren't working as well as they used to.
You are compliant with care but haven't been tested in 3 years.
You are open to medical referral but primarily want to hear better in social situations.
